title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: searcher package includes powerful prompt management system working AI assistants. vignette explains use system create, manage, apply effective prompts using AI search functions. complements main vignette("search--ai-assistants", package = "searcher"), provides broader overview using AI services R.

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: Prompts instructions guide AI assistant respond queries. well-crafted prompt can dramatically improve quality relevance AI responses R programming tasks.

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: searcher package provides multi-level prompt system: System-level prompts: Set ai_prompt(), apply across AI services Service-specific prompts: Set options() within function calls Default prompts: Built-prompts ship package search AI assistant, prompts applied order (query end).

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: package comes several pre-defined prompts optimized different R programming scenarios: show prompts like: general: Balanced general R questions errors debugging: identifying fixing bugs R code learning: learning R concepts progressive complexity package_selection: comparing R packages balanced analysis code_review: evaluating improving R code stats_analysis: statistical analysis R visualization: creating effective data visualizations
code: # List available prompts ai_prompt_list()

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: set system-level prompt used AI search functions: ’ll see message indicating prompt used: AI receive prompt instruction query, helping respond effectively.
code: # Use a built-in prompt ai_prompt("debugging")  # Then search with any AI service ask_chatgpt("Error: object 'mtcrs' not found")  # Note the typo Using prompts: system (debugging) Searching query in a web browser...

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: can also use custom prompt text directly:
code: # Set a custom prompt ai_prompt("As an R package developer, explain this error in terms of how R handles namespaces:")  # Check the active prompt ai_prompt_active()

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: can check currently active prompt clear :
code: # Check currently active prompt ai_prompt() # or ai_prompt_active()  # Clear the active prompt ai_prompt(NA) # or ai_prompt_clear()

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: can add prompts library:
code: # Register a new prompt ai_prompt_register(   "shiny_expert",   "As a Shiny app developer, explain how to implement this UI feature or fix this reactive issue:" )  # Use your new prompt ai_prompt("shiny_expert")

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: remove prompt library:
code: ai_prompt_remove("shiny_expert")

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: section, explore advanced usage prompt system. includes layering multiple prompts, creating session prompt library, managing prompts .Rprofile persistent settings.

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: prompt system supports layering multiple prompts: use three prompts order (debugging, “Focus tidyverse solutions”, “Explain simple terms”) query.
code: # Set a system-level prompt ai_prompt("debugging")  # Use with service-specific default prompt options(searcher.claude_prompt = "Focus on tidyverse solutions:")  # Then use with a function-call prompt ask_claude("Error in filter(data, x > 0): object 'x' not found",               prompt = "Explain in simple terms:")

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: advanced usage, can create custom prompt library R session:
code: # Create custom prompts for different projects ai_prompt_register("my_package", "As an R package developer reviewing the 'mypackage' codebase.") ai_prompt_register("data_cleaning", "Analyzing the customer_data.csv dataset with missing values.") ai_prompt_register("reporting", "Create a Quarto document report for business stakeholders.")  # Switch between contexts as you work ai_prompt("my_package") # ... work on package development ...  ai_prompt("data_cleaning") # ... work on data cleaning ...

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: persistent prompt management, can add code .Rprofile file executed every time start R, allowing set environment. users .Rprofile file home directory. can create edit file include prompt management code. create edit .Rprofile file, can use following command R: , can add following code set prompt management system:
code: # Creating or editing the file: file.edit("~/.Rprofile") # In .Rprofile .First <- function() {   if (requireNamespace("searcher", quietly = TRUE)) {     # Register custom prompts     searcher::ai_prompt_register(       "work",       "As an R analyst at XYZ company working with our sales database:",        overwrite = TRUE     )          # Set default prompts for different AI services     options(       searcher.chatgpt_prompt = "Provide R code with tidyverse packages:",       searcher.claude_prompt = "Give me both base R and tidyverse solutions:"     )          # Set a default system-level prompt if desired     # searcher::ai_prompt("debugging")   } }

title: Managing AI Prompts in `searcher`
text: prompt management system searcher provides flexible powerful way create, manage, apply prompts AI search functions. using system-level prompts, service-specific prompts, custom prompts, can tailor AI’s responses specific needs context. approach enhances quality AI-generated responses , subsequently, helps save time improve efficiency R workflow. system presented vignette transforms custom prompts described vignette("search--ai-assistants", package = "searcher") one-tools systematic library can maintained, shared, reused. represents shift ad-hoc prompting deliberate approach treats prompts valuable assets R programming toolkit.

title: Search Patterns
text: trying solve problem, part process research attempts made others. common form research query search portal. One downside approach search portal set operators query phrasing yield relevant content. result, domain knowledge able format search query way better. Still many queries constrained enough programming language used. goal searcher attempt address needs providing convenient pre-specified search interface tailors results R.

title: Search Patterns
text: begin using searcher, first install package CRAN. installed, searching searcher done using one search_*() functions. access functions, either use namespace function call searcher::search_*() load searcher package , , call function.
code: # Install the searcher package if not already installed install.packages("searcher") # Loads the searcher package library("searcher")  # Searches using Google for `tips` search_google("tips")

title: Search Patterns
text: Within searcher package, search_*() function parameter rlang = TRUE. default, enforces search guarantees R-specific results. rlang = FALSE, results generalized. search engines affix "r programming" end query constrain results R-specific. "r programming" selected performed best compared "rlang", "rstats", "r language" Google Trends. StackOverflow: <query> + [r] Twitter: <query> + #rstats Posit Community (formerly RStudio Community): <query> Rseek: <query> GitHub Search: <query> language:r type:issue Bitbucket Search: <query> lang:r

title: Search Patterns
text: improve R-related search query, suggested use: "r remove legends ggplot" baseline search query. "ggplot2 fix x-axis labels." package R-specific, may help dropping r instead focusing package name start query. "r ggplot2 center graph title 2018 site:stackoverflow.com specifying package name, year, target site “freshest” solution likely found. Suggestions pooled discussion rOpenSci’s slack Steph Locke Robert Mitchell.

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: searcher package now enables direct interaction various AI assistants directly R environment. vignette explains use features enhance R programming workflow leveraging AI-powered assistance.

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: package supports following AI services: ChatGPT (ask_chatgpt()) - OpenAI’s popular large language model Claude (ask_claude()) - Anthropic’s assistant known longer context thoughtful responses Perplexity (ask_perplexity()) - Research-focused AI internet search capabilities Mistral (ask_mistral()) - Mistral AI’s assistant strong reasoning capabilities Bing Copilot (ask_bing_copilot() ask_copilot()) - Microsoft’s AI assistant web search integration Meta AI (ask_meta_ai()) - Meta’s conversational AI assistant

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: use AI services, simply call corresponding function query:
code: library(searcher)  # Ask ChatGPT a question about R ask_chatgpt("How do I create a scatterplot with ggplot2?")  # Get Claude to explain a statistical concept ask_claude("Explain GAMs (Generalized Additive Models) in R")  # Research time series forecasting methods ask_perplexity("What are the best time series forecasting packages in R?")  # Debug a problematic R function ask_mistral("Debug this function: calculate_median <- function(x) mean(x)")  # Compare programming approaches with Bing Copilot ask_copilot("Compare data.table vs dplyr for large datasets")  # Ask Meta AI about best practices ask_metaai("What's the best way to handle missing data in R?")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: One powerful feature AI search functions ability customize AI responds using prompts. can done two ways:

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: one-time customization, provide prompt parameter AI search function:
code: # Ask for step-by-step debugging ask_chatgpt("Why doesn't this work? mtcars %>% filter(cyl = 4)",               prompt = "You are an R debugging expert. Identify the error and explain step by step:")  # Request tidyverse-focused solutions  ask_claude("How to reshape data?",              prompt = "Answer using tidyverse packages, particularly tidyr:")  # Ask for educational examples ask_perplexity("How to implement PCA in R?",                  prompt = "Provide a beginner-friendly tutorial with examples:")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: persistent customization, set default prompts .Rprofile beginning session:
code: # Set default prompts options(   searcher.chatgpt_prompt = "As an R data visualization expert, please help with:",   searcher.claude_prompt = "Provide reproducible R code examples for:",   searcher.perplexity_prompt = "Provide evidence-based R solutions with references:" )  # Now all queries will use these default prompts ask_chatgpt("How to create a heatmap?")  ask_claude("Efficient way to merge multiple dataframes")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: particularly useful feature ability automatically search errors AI assistants:
code: # Set Claude as your error handler options(error = ask_claude)  # Now any error will automatically be sent to Claude fibonacci <- function(n) {   if(n <= 0) return(0)   if(n == 1) return(1)   return(fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)) }  # This will cause a stack overflow error that will be automatically searched fibonacci(1000)  # You can also manually search the last error ask_chatgpt()  # Searches the last error message

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: Well-crafted prompts essential getting interactions AI assistants. providing clear, structured prompts, can dramatically improve quality, relevance, usefulness AI responses. prompts can also tailored specific AI service using, strengths weaknesses “quirks.” section explores effective prompt strategies different R programming scenarios.

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: Prompts serve instructions guide AI assistant respond query. good prompt typically includes: Role specification: AI act (e.g., “R programming expert”) Task definition: AI (e.g., “Debug code”) Output format: responses structured (e.g., “Provide step--step explanations”) Context: relevant background information (e.g., “beginner’s tutorial”)

what: Tailoring Prompts to Different AI Services
title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: Different AI services different strengths characteristics. Varying prompts selecting right service can yield better results. general guidelines tailoring prompts specific AI services: ChatGPT: Responds well direct, structured instructions specific constraints Claude: Excels narrative prompts nuanced instructions reasoning Perplexity: Works best prompts request citations multiple perspectives Mistral: Benefits clear, concise prompts explicit output formatting Bing Copilot: Responds well prompts involve web knowledge current information Meta AI: Still newcomer, generally effective straightforward queries

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: debugging R code, effective prompts guide AI identify specific issue provide clear explanation. improved prompt effective : Establishes clear role (debugging expert) Structures analysis process (identify → explain → solve) Focuses learning (explaining underlying concept)
code: # Less effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "Fix this code:")  # More effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "You are an R debugging expert. First identify what's wrong with this code without fixing it. Then explain why it's wrong and what concept I'm misunderstanding. Finally, provide a working solution with an explanation of why it works.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: using AI learn R concepts, prompts encourage clear explanations progressive complexity. approach works well : Creates teaching scenario encourages clear communication Requests multiple perspectives (basic advanced) Asks concrete examples, just theory Encourages connections existing knowledge
code: # Less effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "Explain this R concept:")  # More effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "As an R educator teaching a diverse classroom, explain this concept in multiple ways: 1) Start with an intuitive explanation a beginner would understand, 2) Provide a simple working example, 3) Explain how this concept connects to other R concepts like {relevant_concepts}, 4) Show a more advanced practical application with commented code.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: seeking advice package selection, prompts encourage comprehensive, balanced comparisons. strategy works : Explicitly requests multiple options instead single answer Defines specific comparison criteria Asks situation-dependent recommendations Requests evidence/citations support claims
code: # Less effective prompt ask_perplexity(prompt = "What package should I use for this?")  # More effective prompt ask_perplexity(prompt = "As an unbiased R consultant familiar with the entire CRAN ecosystem, compare the top 3-4 R packages for this task. For each package, discuss: 1) Key strengths and limitations, 2) Ease of use and learning curve, 3) Community support and maintenance status, 4) Performance characteristics, 5) Unique features. Conclude with situational recommendations (when each would be the best choice) rather than a single recommendation. Include citations to benchmarks or articles where relevant.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: code review prompts, focus balancing constructive criticism actionable improvements. approach effective : Balances positive feedback constructive criticism Covers multiple dimensions code quality Provides specific examples, just general advice Includes structured evaluation framework
code: # Less effective prompt ask_mistral(prompt = "Review this code:")  # More effective prompt ask_mistral(prompt = "As a senior R developer conducting a code review: 1) Note what the code does correctly, 2) Identify potential issues in correctness, performance, readability, and maintainability, 3) Suggest specific improvements with before/after code examples, 4) If relevant, mention R idioms or functions that would simplify the code, 5) Rate the code on a 1-10 scale for efficiency, readability, and robustness.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: seeking help statistical methods R, prompts emphasize theoretical understanding practical implementation. works well : Connects statistical theory R implementation Provides complete workflow preparation interpretation Includes validation limitations Balances code explanations
code: # Less effective prompt ask_claude(prompt = "Help me analyze this data:")  # More effective prompt ask_claude(prompt = "As both a statistician and R programmer, help me with this analysis task. First, explain the appropriate statistical approach and why it's suitable for this situation. Then, provide an R implementation with explanations of: 1) Required packages, 2) Data preparation steps, 3) The analysis code with comments explaining each step, 4) How to interpret the outputs, 5) Diagnostic checks to validate assumptions, 6) Potential limitations of this approach. Show output examples where helpful.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: data visualization queries, prompts focus design principles, just code implementation. Though, want specify visualization created specific package (e.g., ggplot2, plotly, etc.). approach effective : Focuses visualization strategy, just implementation Explains reasoning behind design choices Provides customization options Grounds recommendations best practices
code: # Less effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "Create a visualization of this data:")  # More effective prompt ask_chatgpt(prompt = "As a data visualization expert who specializes in R: 1) Recommend 2-3 visualization types that would best represent this data and explain why, 2) For the most appropriate visualization, provide ggplot2 code with a clear aesthetic mapping rationale, 3) Suggest specific customizations to improve readability and visual appeal, 4) Explain how the visualization could be modified to highlight different aspects of the data. Follow ggplot2 best practices and modern data visualization principles.")

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: power prompt engineering comes experimentation. Consider two prompts produce different results query handling missing data: well-structured prompts, yield different responses focused either technical depth practical application.
code: # Technical focus ask_claude(prompt =    "As an R package developer with deep knowledge of data structures, explain all approaches to handling missing values in R, including their algorithmic implementations, performance characteristics, and edge cases." )  # Applied focus ask_claude(prompt =    "As a data scientist who regularly cleans messy datasets, share your practical workflow for handling missing values in R. Include code examples using both base R and tidyverse approaches, focusing on real-world scenarios and decision criteria for when to use each technique." )

title: Using AI Assistants with searcher
text: AI assistant integration searcher provides way access AI help directly R environment without needing API key external setup. customizing prompts, can tailor AI’s responses specific needs, making even powerful tool R programming, data analysis, problem-solving. Though, keep mind AI services different strengths “quirks”, experiment find works best particular needs.

Example workflow searching asking AI assistants questions R.

title: searcher - Search from R
text: searcher package available CRAN GitHub. CRAN version considered stable GitHub version state development may break. can install stable version searcher package : development version, can opt :
code: install.packages("searcher") if(!requireNamespace("remotes")) { install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("coatless-rpkg/searcher")

title: searcher - Search from R
code: library(searcher)

title: searcher - Search from R
text: search_*() functions can used search query directly R major search engines, programming help websites, code repositories. following search platforms supported: Google, Bing, DuckDuckGo, Startpage, Ecosia, rseek, Qwant, Brave, Kagi, X (formerly Twitter), BlueSky, Mastodon, StackOverflow, Posit Community, GitHub, grep.app, BitBucket. default, appropriate suffix platform ensures relevant results R appended queries. behavior can disabled using rlang = FALSE.
code: # Searching R project on major search engines search_google("R project") search_bing("R project") search_ecosia("R project") search_rseek("R project") search_qwant("R project") search_brave("R project") search_kagi("R project") search_duckduckgo("R project")                           # or search_ddg(...) search_startpage("R project")                            # or search_sp(...)  # Searching X/Twitter to find out about machine learning for R and in general search_twitter("machine learning") search_twitter("machine learning", rlang = FALSE)  # Searching BlueSky to find out about deep learning for R and in general search_bluesky("deep learning") search_bluesky("deep learning", rlang = FALSE)  # Searching Mastodon to find out about data visualization for R and in general search_mastodon("data vis") search_mastodon("data vis", rlang = FALSE)  # Searching SO for linear regression questions for R and in general search_stackoverflow("linear regression") search_stackoverflow("linear regression", rlang = FALSE) # or search_so(...)  # Searching Posit Community for tips search_posit_community("tips") search_posit_community("tips", rlang = FALSE)          # or search_posit(...)  # Searching GitHub code for graphs in R and other languages search_grep("graph") search_grep("graph", rlang = FALSE)  # Searching GitHub Issues for maps in R and other languages search_github("maps") search_github("maps", rlang = FALSE)                     # or search_gh(...)  # Searching BitBucket for assertions in R and other languages search_bitbucket("assertions") search_bitbucket("assertions", rlang = FALSE)            # or search_bb(...)

title: searcher - Search from R
text: package also provides functions query AI assistants directly R. functions open browser query pre-filled, using customizable prompts help AI give effective responses R programming: AI search functions accept optional prompt parameter guides AI responds: See vignette("search--ai-assistants") details using AI assistants searches searcher.
code: # Get coding help from AI assistants ask_chatgpt("How to create a ggplot scatterplot with regression line?") ask_claude("Explain what purrr::map_df does") ask_perplexity("Compare dplyr vs data.table performance") ask_mistral("How to handle missing data in R?") ask_bing_copilot("Write a function to calculate the median") ask_meta_ai("What are the best R packages for time series analysis?")  # Search with an error message tryCatch(   cor(mtcrs),  # Intentional typo   error = function(e) ask_claude()  # Will search the error message ) # Adding specific instructions to the prompt ask_chatgpt(   "Fix this code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(x=mpg, y=hp) + geom_point()",    prompt = "You are an R debugging expert. Explain what's wrong step by step." )

title: searcher - Search from R
text: searcher offers preliminary support automatically manually searching errors generated R. robust error search support also search warning messages, please use errorist package.

title: searcher - Search from R
text: Searching last error automatically possible registering function R’s error handler via either searcher(site="") one search_*() functions. Thus, error occurs, function automatically called. triggers new browser window open error term listed verbatim.
code: # Using the generic search error handler options(error = searcher("google"))  # Directly specify the search function options(error = search_github) options(error = search_google)

title: searcher - Search from R
text: Alternatively, functions can also used manually default error dispatch preserved. manual case, explicitly call search function. , browser window open last error message search query desired search portal.
code: search_google() search_bing() search_ecosia() search_rseek() search_qwant() search_brave() search_kagi() search_grep() search_mastodon() search_bluesky() search_twitter()           # or search_x() search_duckduckgo()        # or search_ddg() search_startpage()         # or search_sp() search_stackoverflow()     # or search_so() search_posit_community()   # or search_posit() search_github()            # or search_gh() search_bitbucket()         # or search_bb()

title: searcher - Search from R
text: ability customize different operations searcher possible setting values options() within ~/.Rprofile. Presently, following options available: searcher.launch_delay: Amount time launching web browser command issued. Default 0.5 seconds. searcher.use_rstudio_viewer: Display search results RStudio viewer pane instead web browser. Default FALSE. searcher.default_keyword: Suffix keyword focus search results either "base" "tidyverse". Default "base". searcher.chatgpt_prompt: Default prompt ChatGPT queries, used specific prompt provided. searcher.claude_prompt: Default prompt Claude queries. searcher.perplexity_prompt: Default prompt Perplexity queries. searcher.mistral_prompt: Default prompt Mistral AI queries. searcher.bing_copilot_prompt: Default prompt Bing Copilot queries. searcher.meta_ai_prompt: Default prompt Meta AI queries. set one options, please create .Rprofile typing R: , add:
code: file.edit("~/.Rprofile") .First = function() {   options(     searcher.launch_delay       = 0,     searcher.use_rstudio_viewer = FALSE,     searcher.default_keyword    = "tidyverse",     searcher.chatgpt_prompt     = "You are an R programming expert. Please provide concise answers with code examples.",     ## Additional options.   ) }

title: searcher - Search from R
text: frequently use AI assistants, searcher provides prompt management system: See vignette("managing-ai-prompts") details prompt management system.
code: # List available prompts ai_prompt_list()  # Set a system-level prompt for all AI services ai_prompt("debugging")  # Use a predefined prompt for debugging  # Create custom prompts ai_prompt_register("my_prompt", "As an R expert analyzing the mtcars dataset...")  # Check active prompt ai_prompt_active()  # Clear active prompt ai_prompt_clear()

title: searcher - Search from R
text: idea searcher began project automatically search errors warnings occurred working R conversation among Dirk Eddelbuettel, Barry Rowlingson, . However, search interface allowed querying directly R outside built-utils::RSiteSearch(), queries http://search.r-project.org/, sos package, queries -site user premade database. options focused solely querying R documentation made available packages. Given nature errors generally undocumented, neither approaches used. Thus, searcher unintentionally born provide means errorist, contains robust way automatically searching errors warnings.

text: Dirk Eddelbuettel starting discussion XKCD Comic 1185: Ineffective Sorts. Barry Rowlingson remarks functionality.

text: #rstats-twitter verse (c.f. https://twitter.com/search?q=%23rstats), searcher positively received community members. R package “searcher” automatically searches Stackoverflow error just saw console. Cool package, especially learn R :) https://github.com/coatless-rpkg/searcher … #r #rlang #rstats #rstudio — Paweł Przytuła March 23th, 2019. ~292 Retweets 876 likes (Note, URL updated new repository location.) know, using “searcher” package, automatically search stackoverflow, google, GitHub many sites errors, packages topics. #rstats — Shakirah Nakalungi (c.f. https://twitter.com/cynthia_kyra) June 29th, 2019, Rotating Curator “R-Ladies” twitter account (c.f. https://twitter.com/WeAreRLadies/status/1144921174251581440) ~144 Retweets 544 likes Please let us know via issue ticket using searcher.

title: Remove an AI Prompt from the Library — ai_prompt_remove
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Remove a prompt ai_prompt_remove("tidyverse") } # }

what: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
title: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
text: Creates search function specifically interacting AI services. Unlike regular search functions, AI searchers support custom prompts can guide AI responds queries.

title: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
code: ai_searcher(site)

title: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
text: site Name site search (e.g., "chatgpt", "claude")

title: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
text: function can used search specified AI service optional prompt customization

title: Searcher Function Generator for AI Services — ai_searcher
text: returned function apply prompts following priority order: System-level prompt set via ai_prompt() () Function call prompt service-specific option query returned function accepts two parameters: query: question request send AI (defaults last error message) prompt: Custom prompt guide AI's response (optional)

code: # Basic query ask_bing_copilot("Latest R package for geospatial analysis") #> Please type into your browser: #> https://www.bing.com/search?showconv=1&sendquery=1&q=Latest%20R%20package%20for%20geospatial%20analysis  # Using a custom prompt ask_bing_copilot("Write a function to calculate the median",                  prompt = "Show multiple approaches:") #> Using prompts: function call #> Please type into your browser: #> https://www.bing.com/search?showconv=1&sendquery=1&q=Show%20multiple%20approaches:%20Write%20a%20function%20to%20calculate%20the%20median

code: search_site(   query,   site = c("google", "bing", "duckduckgo", "ddg", "startpage", "sp", "qwant", "rseek",     "brave", "kagi", "posit community", "posit", "twitter", "x", "bluesky", "mastodon",     "stackoverflow", "so", "github", "gh", "grep", "bitbucket", "bb", "chatgpt",     "claude", "perplexity", "mistral", "bing copilot", "copilot", "meta ai", "meta"),   rlang = TRUE,   prompt = NULL )

title: Search a Query on a Search Portal in a Web Browser — search_site
text: query Contents string search. Default error message. site Name site search . Supported options: "google" (default), "bing", "duckduckgo" "ddg", "startpage"  (formerly "ixquick") "sp", "qwant", "rseek", "brave", "kagi", "posit community" (formerly "rstudio community") "posit", "twitter" "x", "bluesky", "mastodon", "stackoverflow", "github", "grep", "bitbucket", "chatgpt", "claude", "perplexity", "mistral", "bing copilot" "copilot", "meta ai" "meta". rlang Search results written R. Default TRUE prompt Optional prompt prefix add query guide AI responds. NULL, uses service-specific default prompt option.

title: Defunct functions in searcher — searcher-defunct
text: Functions listed longer included searcher package

title: Defunct functions in searcher — searcher-defunct
text: search_ixquick(): function binding removed search engine name changed "Startpage". Please use search_startpage(). search_rstudio_community(): function binding removed company name changed "Posit". Please use search_posit_community(). search_rscom(): function binding removed company name changed "Posit". Please use search_posit().

title: searcher: Query Search Interfaces — searcher-package
text: Provides search interface look terms 'Google', 'Bing', 'DuckDuckGo', 'Startpage', 'Ecosia', 'rseek', 'Twitter', 'StackOverflow', 'RStudio Community', 'GitHub', 'BitBucket'. Upon searching, browser window open aforementioned search results.

title: searcher: Query Search Interfaces — searcher-package
text: searcher accesses set default values stored options() call keep function signatures small. default, options given : searcher.launch_delay: Amount time remain R opening browser window. Default 0.5 seconds. searcher.use_rstudio_viewer: Display search results RStudio viewer pane instead web browser. Default FALSE. searcher.default_keyword: Suffix keyword generate accurate results either "base" "tidyverse". Default "base". ...

title: searcher: Query Search Interfaces — searcher-package
text: Maintainer: James Balamuta balamut2@illinois.edu (ORCID) contributors: Alex Rossell Hayes alexander@rossellhayes.com (ORCID) [contributor]

title: Generate a Searcher function for use with Error Handling — searcher
code: ### Manually searcher("google")() #> Please type into your browser: #> https://google.com/search?q=test.r:1:1:%20unexpected%20'%3C'%0A1:%20%3C%0A%20%20%20%20%5E%20r%20programming  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ### Automatically # On error, automatically search the message on google options(error = searcher("google")) } # }

title: searcher 0.0.5
text: search_twitter(): Searches Twitter. (#19, #30) searcher.launch_delay controls long user remains R prior browser opening. Default 0.5 seconds. searcher.use_rstudio_viewer specifies whether RStudio’s viewer pane open link instead web browser. Default FALSE RStudio’s sandbox issue resolved. searcher.default_keyword: Suffix keyword focus search results either "base" "tidyverse". Default "base". Note: feature requires patch per rstudio/rstudio#2252. (#21, #22)
